channel.title: 经济学人
channel.description: 这是一个追踪经济学人news的种子

item.title: 特姆优会赢得美国购物者的青睐吗？在本周的 "Money Talks "播客中，我们将问亚马逊和 Etsy 等公司应该如何担心中国电子商务巨头🎧？
item.description:
Will Temu win over American shoppers? This week on our “Money Talks” podcast, we ask how worried companies such as Amazon and Etsy should be about the Chinese e-commerce giant https://t.co/TEC6MN9MjL 🎧

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 能见度曾经是英国王室的标志。然而，威尔士王妃的癌症诊断表明，王室成员的受关注程度已经大大降低 ⬇️。
item.description:
Visibility was once the point of Britain’s royals. However as the Princess of Wales's cancer diagnosis shows, the royals’ appetite for being watched has, quite reasonably, diminished https://t.co/TuIitNWkMG ⬇️

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 印度历史上第一次有现任首席部长被投入监狱。Arvind Kejriwal 的被捕只是反对党联盟遭遇的最新不幸👇。
item.description:
For the first time in India’s history, a sitting chief minister has been thrown in jail. Arvind Kejriwal’s arrest is only the latest misfortune to strike the opposition alliance https://t.co/61UBqO4UyH 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 美国官员告诉几家新闻机构，他们认为是 "伊斯兰国 "所为。事件发生两周前，西方国家驻莫斯科大使馆发出警告，称莫斯科即将发生恐怖袭击，建议市民避免参加大型集会👇。
item.description:
American officials told several news outlets that they thought Islamic State was to blame. The incident came two weeks after warnings from Western embassies of an impending terrorist attack in Moscow, advising citizens to avoid large gatherings https://t.co/XgF7R6FZMv 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 拉丁裔选票在 11 月会有多重要？在 "制衡 "节目中： 🎧 @NALEO 的阿图罗-巴尔加斯谈如何赢得美国拉美裔选票 🎧 @madrid_mike 谈小布什如何获得拉美裔选票 🎧 @daniella_raz 谈至关重要的亚利桑那州
item.description:
How important will the Latino vote be in November? On “Checks and Balance”: https://t.co/IOPmpnhbtk

🎧 @NALEO’s Arturo Vargas on how to win America’s Hispanic vote
🎧 @madrid_mike on how George W. Bush got Latino votes
🎧 @daniella_raz on the crucial state of Arizona

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 美国担心社交媒体。中国也一样。但在拜登政府追捕错误信息的同时，中国共产党却在拼命铲除任何与其路线相悖的东西👇。
item.description:
America is worried about social media. So is China. But while the Biden administration goes after misinformation, the Communist Party desperately tries to root out anything that contradicts its line https://t.co/Xv1DWrcoRB 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 多年来，美国的新购房者一直享受着比租房者更低的房价。但如今，买房和租房之间的选择看起来大不相同。阅读原因 👇
item.description:
For years new home-buyers in America have enjoyed lower housing payments than renters. But today the choice between buying and renting looks very different. Read why https://t.co/mDhkJ8dPJu 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 股市一路高歌猛进，全球经济出人意料地蓬勃发展，许多专家学者都在后悔发出了未来将是艰难时期的悲观警告。他们对经济的判断可能是错误的。但从一个方面来看，他们的悲观似乎是正确的👇。
item.description:
With stockmarkets on a tear and the global economy surprisingly buoyant, plenty of pundits are regretting gloomy warnings of tough times ahead. They may have been wrong about the economy. But in one respect their gloom looks spot on https://t.co/u49zudDV5G 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 22, 2024

item.title: 中国正陷入低生育率陷阱。中国的独生子女政策可能已不复存在，但其有害影响却挥之不去 👇。
item.description:
China is in a low-fertility trap. The country’s one-child policy may be gone, but its harmful effects linger https://t.co/JwJJLm60fI 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 22, 2024

item.title: 非洲被夹在两个海底电缆危险热点之间。这导致了整个非洲大陆的互联网连接问题👇。
item.description:
Africa is wedged between two undersea cable-hazard hotspots. This is causing internet connection problems across the continent https://t.co/lfVOzerBkg 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 22, 2024

item.title: 在莫斯科音乐厅发生的造成数十人死亡的袭击发生后数小时内，"伊斯兰国 "发表声明，声称对此次袭击负责。该声明无法核实👇。
item.description:
Within hours of the attack that killed dozens in a Moscow concert hall, Islamic State had issued a statement claiming responsibility. The claim was impossible to verify https://t.co/9Lb3l9aALh 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 22, 2024

item.title: 对苹果公司的起诉标志着监管部门对这家曾经风光无限的 iPhone 制造商的打击升级。
item.description:
The case against Apple marks an escalation in a regulatory onslaught against the once-charmed iPhone-maker.

Even if the company wins, it could still suffer the consequences https://t.co/eaBplXhnFt 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 22, 2024

item.title: 我们的中国问题特约撰稿人 @jarmiles 三十多年来每年都会报道全国人民代表大会。在 "鼓楼 "节目中，他探讨了全国两会的变化🎧。
item.description:
Our China writer-at-large, @jarmiles, has been covering the National People’s Congress annually for more than three decades. On “Drum Tower” he explores how it’s changed https://t.co/dHKwcFZSYw 🎧

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 22, 2024

item.title: 巴勒斯坦人担心他们的新政府首脑将为总统服务，而不是为人民服务 👇
item.description:
Palestinians fear their new head of government will serve their president, not the people https://t.co/OEE5ylkz8g 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 22, 2024

item.title: 在西方大使馆发出俄罗斯首都即将发生恐怖袭击的警告两周后，一群蒙面枪手手持自动步枪向演出现场的人群开火：
item.description:
A group of masked gunmen with automatic rifles opened fire on crowds at a gig, two weeks after warnings from Western embassies of an impending terrorist attack in the Russian capital: https://t.co/6hHAreDg15 pic.twitter.com/H5oU8Q6Dyl

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 22, 2024

item.title: 俄罗斯国家媒体的初步报道称，至少有 40 人死亡，100 多人受伤 ⬇️
item.description:
At least 40 people have been killed and more than 100 wounded, initial reports from Russian state media say https://t.co/sad7uiLESQ ⬇️

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 22, 2024

item.title: 欧洲折扣连锁店是大西洋两岸增长最快的零售商 👇
item.description:
The European discount chain is the fastest-growing retailer across the Atlantic https://t.co/fR9XQAHIog 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 22, 2024

item.title: 经纪人与房主之间达成的和解协议是否会带来竞争加剧、佣金降低的乌托邦，这一点并不明确。要接受一项保护经纪人免受未来诉讼的协议，风险太大👇。
item.description:
It’s not at all clear that a settlement agreed between agents and homeowners will bring about a Utopia of greater competition and lower commissions.

The stakes are too high to accept a deal that protects brokers from future lawsuits https://t.co/lcHQLNTp2k 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 22, 2024

item.title: 自从她做手术的消息公布后，各种阴谋论甚嚣尘上。她的声明将结束人们的猜测，但很难想象人们会给予她所要求的隐私：
item.description:
Since news of her operation was released, conspiracy theories have flourished. Her statement will end speculation, but it is hard to imagine people giving her the privacy requested: https://t.co/9HSJA3pI9B pic.twitter.com/RNJVT1Gmib

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 22, 2024

item.title: 自她的手术消息公布以来，阴谋论甚嚣尘上。她的声明将终止人们的猜测，但很难想象人们会给予她所要求的隐私 ⬇️。
item.description:
Since news of her operation was released, conspiracy theories have flourished. Her statement will end speculation, but it is hard to imagine people giving her the privacy requested https://t.co/OTYUs1RYKA ⬇️

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 22, 2024

item.title: 尼日利亚的高成本石油产业正在衰退。这将给出口和公共财政留下巨大缺口 👇
item.description:
Nigeria’s high-cost oil industry is in decline. That will leave a gaping hole in exports and public finances https://t.co/0KohT7l0hw 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 22, 2024

item.title: 投资者对待选举的态度各不相同。一些人将政治视为可以利用的优势，另一些人则将其视为可以屏蔽的噪音。无论如何，政治越来越难以被忽视 👇
item.description:
Investors differ in their approach to elections. Some see politics as an edge to exploit; others as noise to block out. Either way, it is becoming harder to ignore https://t.co/uaeKmlv1A1 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 22, 2024

item.title: 这位高盛集团的前合伙人在唐纳德-特朗普担任总统期间一直担任财政部长一职，如今他又跃上了舆论的风口浪尖。他的野心有限度吗？ 👇
item.description:
The former partner at Goldman Sachs served as treasury secretary throughout the presidency of Donald Trump and has leapt back into the limelight. Is there any limit to his ambitions? https://t.co/yqxcSeML70 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 22, 2024

item.title: 这十张图表比较了乔-拜登和唐纳德-特朗普的记录。谁更胜一筹？ 👇
item.description:
These ten charts compare Joe Biden’s record with Donald Trump’s. Who comes out better? https://t.co/TCZEDiBhNV 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 22, 2024

item.title: 每当曼德海峡成为新闻焦点时，它往往被描述为世界上最繁忙航道之一的咽喉要道和战略要地。对于非洲移民来说，该海峡是通往中东的险峻门户
item.description:
When the Bab al-Mandab strait makes the news it is often described as a chokepoint, a strategic vulnerability for one of the world’s busiest shipping lanes.

For African migrants the crossing offers a treacherous gateway to the Middle East https://t.co/RTq7pykC6m

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 22, 2024

item.title: 五名枪手向莫斯科附近的一个音乐厅开火，造成至少 40 人死亡，100 人受伤。据当地媒体报道，现场传来几声爆炸声。关注最新消息 👉 路透社
item.description:
Five gunmen opened fire at a concert hall near Moscow, killing at least 40 people and injuring 100 others. Local media reported that several explosions had been heard at the site.

Follow the latest news 👉 https://t.co/LEMzlacd3M

Photo: Reuters

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 22, 2024

item.title: 墨西哥有数万人失踪。当局没有在寻找他们，而总统却在破坏他所取得的一点点进展：
item.description:
Tens of thousands of people are missing in Mexico. The authorities are not looking for them, and the president is undoing what little progress he made: https://t.co/dwz94UN654 pic.twitter.com/ZZeuqczc1t

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 22, 2024

item.title: 得克萨斯州州长认为乔-拜登的移民政策过于宽松。基于这一观点，他挑起了一场法律之争，争论哪一级政府有权控制边境政策👇。
item.description:
Texas’s governor thinks Joe Biden’s policy on immigration is too lax. Acting on that belief, he has picked a legal fight over which level of government has the right to control border policy https://t.co/PcDatEMbH4 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 22, 2024

item.title: 万一格雷格-阿博特（Greg Abbott）成功实施了自己的移民计划，这位得克萨斯州州长将不得不面对超出国内政治范围的问题👇。
item.description:
In the unlikely event that Greg Abbott ever succeeds in enforcing his own immigration scheme, the Texas governor will have to contend with problems that go beyond domestic politics https://t.co/g7w4dO1tFl 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 22, 2024

item.title: 如果有更多的人在印度国内迁移，印度将会更加富裕。但城市缺乏安全网只是移民面临的一个障碍👇。
item.description:
India would be richer if more people moved within the country. But the lack of a safety-net in cities is just one obstacle migrants face https://t.co/udAMmmtvSx 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 22, 2024
